name: PABADE CAFE AND BAKERY
address: 135 E 110th St, New York, NY 10029, USA

reviews.text: The coziest coffee shop in the neighborhood with the nicest staff. Properü§å cappuccino. Selection of baked goods and savory croissants. Love it ü´∂‚ù§Ô∏è
Best coffee place

Much love to the sweet girlsies at Pabade this morning. Must be a family name! My friend and I are both independently in New York for an extended time for work and we hung out this weekend, stopping for a beverage before walking Central Park. The baristas recommended a spiced chai or a cortado. I tried the cortado w almond milk and my friend got a caramel matcha and a baked good. Very tasty, thank you! Rich body, just like I love. I‚Äôm not sure the price bc my friend paid but a cortado is 1:1 espresso:milk (2oz:2oz) and prob an up charge for alt milk. Xo. I am sad in retrospect that I didn‚Äôt ask about gf bakery options. I didn‚Äôt see any labels for the goodies or like prices as I said, but I saw vegan and flourless descriptions on the website around the time of writing this. All love.
Worth your visit...

Literally the BEST people with the most delicious pastries! Warm, family-owned business. We are longtime wholesale clients and are always impressed with the taste and quality of their pastries. The executive chef literally studies baking techniques in Europe and marries those techniques seamlessly with Columbian heart and soul.

I recently visited this caf√© after reading some rave reviews, but unfortunately, my experience didn‚Äôt quite match the hype, especially when it came to their croissants. I tried the guava croissant, which had an interesting and enjoyable flavor combination, but the croissant itself was disappointing, very doughy and bready rather than flaky, as a croissant should be.

As for the coffee, I was intrigued by their advertised ‚Äúmocha pot coffee,‚Äù expecting a traditional home-style Moka pot brew. However, it turned out to be more of a chocolate syrup mocha, which wasn‚Äôt what I had in mind. While the staff at the front desk were friendly and welcoming, the coffee and pastries left a lot to be desired.

If you‚Äôre looking for a flaky croissant and a robust cup of coffee in the Harlem area, I‚Äôd recommend walking a few blocks over to Super Nice Coffee. There‚Äôs definitely room for improvement here, and I hope to see some changes in the future.

First time guest visiting this bakeshop ‚Ä¶..and besides their wonderful selection of various pastries and sandwiches (wish I had more time to try more)‚Ä¶when entering this treasure on East 110 street you are immediately greeted by either Dahyanna (owner) or Karen (hopefully I spelt her name correctly) .  They make you feel like you are entering their living room.  And once you try any one of their many choices of sweets or coffee or sandwiches‚Ä¶.you are hooked !!  I know I was and I look forward to my next visit.
‚Ä¶.to whoever reads this you must try this ‚Äúdiamond‚Äù.  Satisfaction guaranteed.!!

Les

Cute little place with excellent atmosphere and good music. The salmon croissant was prepared on the spot and was fresh, tasty and nicely packaged. The coffee is varied and delicious and the prices are absolutely reasonable!
I will definitely come back again!

Great little coffee shop. Small seating area but cute. The woman behind the counter was so nice! Felt at home. Didn't have food but we each had a coffee. One drip and one iced. Was very good. Would totally recommend!
Delicious coffee and pastries in a cute little shop. Staff here are always so kind.
Very smooth iced latte üíú‚Ä¶
Deliciously fresh Yucatan bread and nice coffee for conversation!
I ordered a chai with oat milk and an italian croissant with mozzarella cheese, tomato and pesto. Delicious and they had fresh lillies on the table.
Excelente atenci√≥n.. un caf√© colombiano de la mejor calidad y los biscuits son hechos all√≠ mismo !!
Great Salmon Croissant, delicious Alfajores, and very friendly and attentive staff, the Coffee is awful and Pabade must consider getting a new bean provider..
Super friendly with great coffee! The Nutella cruffin was delicious!
Tried the strawberry cheese cruffin & black iced coffee. Pastry was good but not a fan of the coffee.
Amazing ice coffee, amazing pastries I‚Äôve never had!
jamon y queso are SO good. the coffee is made really well and the pastries are incredible. good service and the set up is great

Their sandwishes were superb!  Very delicious...

We had them at the Smallbusiness Conference at Columbia University today.
Great coffee and bakery. Friendly service
This was my favorite coffee shop when i was living in Spanish Harlem. Best fresh pastries and coffee. Staff is super friendly.
Very good and fresh food, and the staff was friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è
Great coffee shop. However, no decaf option is ridiculous.
Best brownie ever!
Es un lugar muy especial, desde el primer momento me sent√≠ como el casa, el caf√© muy delicioso, y todos los panes son muy ricos y de calidad.
El mejor lugar en Harlem tanto para  tomarte un caf√© , como para comer cualquier pastrie, lo recomiendo ampliamente.
Diana made my coffee perfect and the warm buttered pandebono hit the spot. Support this business if you want good service, delicious food and the cozy, intimate atmosphere of an authentic cafe.
Water in the coffee

Any time I have meetings in the city in the area, I have to stop and have their delicious coffee and pastries. I travel by subway from Long Island but I make time to stop by.
Great service ‚ù§Ô∏è
Service is great. This is a small cafe style coffee shop. The vibe is soho village. I make it a point to stop by 1x month when I go to medical appointments near by. Try it you won't be disappointed .
I love this space and the staff they're always a delightful bunch üòä
A mediocre coffee shop. Not particularly good but not awful. Service was fine.
Delicious baguette and delicious coffee!! Great staff! Thank you

The pandabono is beyond good and the staff are very nice
Highly recommended
Cosi and warm
Love this place....small but quite comfortable. Ask for Smiley or M√°rtin.
So delicious!  This place I wish I could give 10 stars -We love their scones and the cappuccinos are delicious üôè
Solid coffee and the pastries look awesome
Nothing better than a warm fresh pandebono and coffee in the morning. Very cozy place, music is perfect to hype you to star the day. Excellent service!
Stopped here and bought cookies and they were amazing!
Delicious bakery in NY!!
Best breakfast I‚Äôve ever had, the coffee was phenomenal. There are only two little tables to sit and eat outside but still very cute and nice!
Harlems best coffee and bakery! The coffee is wonderful, blueberry and cranberry scones are the best I‚Äôve ever had, pumpkin loaf delish and if you want tasty sandwich they have nailed it as well!
This place is very good and reminds me about south america
The best business in the area ‚ù§Ô∏è
Great coffee and sandwiches. The music was pleasing and the staff were very kind. The shop in itself is very small so do not expect it to be someone you can go and relax for a while
Good coffee and great service.

Wonderful neighborhood cafe. Fresh-baked and locally sourced pastries and great coffee. And excellent price: I got a small coffee and an assortment of baked goods (guava croissant, banana bread, 2 chocolate croissants, plain croissant and a blueberry scone) for $21!
Delicios cafe and pastry, i will come back‚ù§Ô∏è

The pastries have been and always are phenomenal. Tasty, fresh, and of the highest quality to meet everyone's taste preferences. I ordered an assortment of pastries for a work meeting, and the team of nearly 20 people absolutely loved it and even took some for colleagues as well. I will definitely be ordering again in the future!! In the past, I have also ordered a box of muffins just for myself to enjoy üòä

Very cool and a cute coffee shop. I got a small cappuccino, ham and cheddar cheese quiche and a strawberry cheese croissant. I paid $13.
The stuff was friendly and nice but only one negative comment; there is no price tag for the coffee nor baked goods so I had to ask for the price for them. They were helpful though but was annoying a bit.

WOW! This place is amazing . Good music , friendly staff ( Martin ) was helpful  . The croissants are delicious . The coffee is  amazing and  great . If you're in Spanish Harlem stop by and get your caffeine on üëç
Update!! (1-15-22)
I can't say enough of this amazing place . I am in love ü•∞ the staff is always friendly and welcoming ‚ò∫Ô∏è and the pastries are amazing . Bake freshly everyday . So if your in the mood to get some delicious caffeine and pastries stop by and say hello üëã

Cute neighborhood bakery with very friendly staff.  Everything I tried was delicious, it's hard to pick a favorite. I would totally recommend the tres leches since it was very moist with a really nice spongy consistency and was just the‚Ä¶

Couldn't be happier with this surprise for my first day of work at the neighborhood. Love the vibe, the interior, the soy latte and my delicious blueberry scone. The price was adorable too for its quality!!! My go-to spit from now, for as long as I am doing business in this area.

My son and my wife have such a sweet tooth! Every day, we need to look for a place where to have a cookie, a cupcake, an ice cream... OK... I have that too, that's true. üòÇ
Again, it's not always easy to find a good place in a city you don't know so well. So Google maps is our friend... Or so we think, because I can't say it's always right...
That day, we tried to go to several of the places Google recommended but they were closed, or out of pastries, or were simply not appealing enough... Finally, we ended up at Pabade Cafe and Bakery. The place is super small. And it was packed because there was a soccer game. But we still could go in, order a few pastries and even sit at the corner of the bar: not so comfy but, at least, it was hotter than the outside!
The staff was so nice and they gave us free pastries on top of what we ordered because they were about to close. Unfortunately the pastries were just ok, really not worth going there on purpose. So was the coffee.
The price was fair too, not too cheap but not too expensive either for NYC standards.
Overall it was a good experience thanks to the very nice people I met at the bar... but this is not a place I would think about recommending.

Quality & taste: 5/10
Quantities: 7/10
Atmosphere: 4/10
Originality: 6/10
Ratio price / quality: 6/10
Service: 10/10
How I felt afterwards: 6/10

More on IG @runnerandfoodie

I loved everything about Pabadeüòç
The vibe, the cafe and the pastries.

Dulce de leche cruffin was more than delicious.

Diana and Marting are amazing and warm
people. Will go back and definitely recommend the place.

There are so many Instagram famous bakeries in NYC, but majority of it are all hype. Pabade is hands down one of the best bakeries in New York. The baked goods, sandwiches, coffee, and pastries speaks for itself, you‚Äôll just have to go‚Ä¶
Amazing coffee shop! Super friendly staff. Feels like home. Freshly baked pastries. I tried tres leches and cheese cakes, both are so delicious! Spinach quiche and salmon sandwich are must try!

It‚Äôs not just that their food is delicious and heartwarming (I had their sandwiches, pastries, and bread), but this bakery has a soul. They know how to uplift your spirit with their generosity, even when you know that they, like other small businesses in NYC, are struggling. Along with my order, I‚Äôd sometimes find a flan that‚Äôs creamy and nostalgic at the same time, or a box of scrumptious pastries (croissant with guava!). It‚Äôs generosity, pure and simple, but also confidence and pride, knowing that what they offer is really good. To the siblings behind this gem, thank you.

What a awesome gem! Came across this popping cafe with good strong coffee and delicious fresh baked pastries. The family that runs the place was so friendly and you can really tell they put love into their food. Definitely will be coming back to this place.
Cute, small, friendly staff, fresh pastries. 2 window seats to eat indoors. Loved our quick coffee and pastry breakfast!

It's cozy, has a few tables tucked in the back, there are delicious empanadas and various pastries and the coffee... it's excellent. Prices are reasonable and the counter staff are friendly and genuine.

Don‚Äôt know what this pastry is called but it was so divine. The espresso is very good. The ladies here are so friendly. Not a lot of space to sit but this bar at the window was nice and warm for a quick stop
Super cute bakery cafe in east harlem. The pastries are delicious. Don‚Äôt forget to order the cheese ham croissant. The staff is super efficient and pleasant.

Wow! This place is amazing. We live nearby. We went there once a few years back and it was fine, but not special. We came back for another chance and it was absolutely amazing. The pastry filled with dulce de leche or Nutella were particularly good.

Friendly staff and good prices too.

This lovely cafe in Spanish Harlem doesn't need another 5 star review. It appears to be a family business, two pastries and a cappuccino for $11 is very reasonable! The space is small, two tables plus a window bar. I was also very impressed by their cleanliness; the two workers are well-masked (October 2022) and wearing gloves adequately.
They have WiFi, for those interested. And they have relaxing music.
I'll be back!
Wonderful tiny coffee place just next to Cetral Park. We had some delicious pies, croissants and great coffee (considering its the US) before visiting Central Park. Very nice stuff.

This place lives up to its reputation on Google! The chocolate chip cookie was delicious. The coffee, and specifically the Cafe au lait, was amazing. The smoked salmon croissant had the perfect salt and sour balance. And my six year old loved the pan au chocolat. Very family friendly, but still high end quality bakery. Lots of gluten free options.

I pop into this neighborhood favorite for quick bites. It's not a wonder, nothing but five star reviews. Literally, you can throw a dart at whatever's on the menu/display case, and it'll be a winner. They're doing everything right here. And, yes!, their flan is smooth, light and AMAZING!
The best chocolate chips scones and some delicious coffee! The owners are just as sweet as can be.

I've put off stopping in for a visit for quite some time; year to be precise and I'm so disappointed in myself. I NEVER pass a coffee shop without trying at least once. And I'm double disappointed in myself since my guy insisted I stop in a‚Ä¶

I love the pastry here. Coffee is pretty good too. Place is small and super cute. The guy behind the register is the only one that rubs me the wrong way. Never friendly and he's dismissive. I read other reviews that it maybe a cultural thing but I'm hispanic so it's just his personality. Makes me not want to spend my money here because of those interactions.
Best little cafe in New York. Freshly baked goods that are awe inspiring everyday, and the nicest people work here. It makes my day every time I come here.
Je recommande fortement ce petit caf√©. Les serveuses sont super sympas et tr√®s accueillantes. Le cadre y est chaleureux. Prenez le temps de leur parler et vous d√©couvrirez de belles personnes.

Opened January 2019.
Nice beautiful cafe serves great pastries.
Loved their quiche :)

I was tasked with bringing food to a work meeting and I'm so glad that I went with Pabade Cafe and Bakery because of the sandwiches and pastries were DELICIOUS! I called a couple days before the day of the meeting to place the order and coordinated with Diana, who is so lovely and sweet! She answered my questions with patience, adjusted the order based on accommodations, and threw in napkins, plates, cups, cutlery (which is really nice to not have to worry about). I'm so glad that I ordered ahead of time because the pastries go quickly and I see why! When I went to pick up, the items were ready, all the workers were kind and helpful, and I chatted with two patrons who expressed that I did good choosing this place--always a great sign! Needless to say, the folks in the meeting enjoyed the food immensely and I ordered an iced latte for myself that had the perfect balance of espresso, milky yumminess and sweetness :) My only regret is not capturing pictures because everything was assembled beautifully. Thank you Diana and everyone at Pabade, I will definitely be frequenting this cafe whenever I'm in Spanish Harlem!
I love this spot! Nice employees. The coffee and baked goods are amazing. Can‚Äôt wait to chat this place up to my friends!
